(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**:50+, Agriculture and food services, education and childcare, emergency services. People age 16 to 64 years with certain significant, high-risk medical conditions or disabilities will become eligible for vaccines statewide, to help save the lives of people who are at high-risk of death and severe complications from COVID-19. [State Fact Sheet identifying health conditions](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/vaccine-high-risk-factsheet.aspx)

**County restrictions**: County Residents and eligible sector residents employed in county.

**Appointment Information**: ** schedule through the [California MyTurn](https://myturn.ca.gov/)system online at: <https://myturn.ca.gov/>**

**Phone numbers:** (833) 422-4255.(For those without internet access)

**Additional Info**: .

(Updated: Apr 5)  **Eligibility**: 16+ (as of Monday Apr 5)

**County restrictions:** Must be a Shasta county resident or work in Shasta county.

**Appointment Information**: Registration for the COVID vaccine through the state My Turn system. <https://myturn.ca.gov>
Didn't find an appointment on my turn? Check mass vaccination clinic and Shasta County vaccination locations 
<https://www.co.shasta.ca.us/ready/covid-19/vaccinations>


**Phone numbers:** Individuals without access to the internet can call the Public Health Services Department at (530) 245-7890.
If you're having trouble with MyTurn or don't have an email address or mobile phone, call the California COVID-19 Hotline at 1-833-422-4255 (M-F 8AM-8PM, Sa-Su 8AM-5PM) for assistance.
**Additional Info:**

(Updated: Apr 1) **Eligibility**: 45+, and those who are 16-64 with [severe health conditions](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx), based on vaccine availability. This includes those **age 45 and older** as well as the education & childcare, foster/resource parents, emergency services, food and agriculture, utilities, and transportation sectors, high-risk congregate settings (shelters, detention facilities), and those who work with the homeless population. 

**County restrictions**: Proof of Tuolumne County residence or employment is required.

**Appointment Information**: Vaccine clinic information and a vaccine interest form for eligible residents can be found here: https://www.tuolumnecounty.ca.gov/1317/COVID-Vaccine

(Updated: Apr 1) **Eligibility**: Vaccinating people 50+, childcare and educators, agriculture and food manufacturing workers, emergency services, and grocery and restaurant workers,  individuals aged 16-64 at the highest risk from COVID-19 as a result of one or more severe health conditions, and individuals who reside in high-risk congregate settings.

**County restrictions**: Vaccine clinics are open to those living in Sonoma County.

**Appointment Information**: A list of vaccination clinics is available here: https://socoemergency.org/emergency/novel-coronavirus/vaccine-information/clinics/

(Updated: April 5) **Eligibility**:50+, **though vaccine supply remains limited.**

**County restrictions**:As healthcare providers are providing vaccine in Santa Clara County, some providers have restrictions.

**Appointment Information**:Go to <https://www.sccgov.org/sites/covid19/Pages/COVID19-vaccine-information-for-public.aspx> to see sites where healthcare providers offering vaccine and to make appointments.

**Phone numbers**:(408) 792-5050 Santa Clara Dept of Public Health 

**Additional Info**:Santa Clara County, VTA has created an [interactive map](https://www.vta.org/sites/default/files/2021-02/FINAL%20VaccinationMap-02-23-21b_SHR.pdf) for the public to find a list of the current vaccination locations, along with the bus or light rail routes to take to each site. Transit trips are free as VTA is [currently not collecting fares](https://www.vta.org/blog/service-frequency-improvements-no-fare-collection-effect-feb-8). When viewers click on any vaccination location on the map, they will be taken to the Google Maps transit option to find the most efficient transit route to get to the destination.
Website has information in Spanish, Chinese, Vietnamese, Tagalong

(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**: Age 16+ for county run clinics. Eligibility for the vaccine may be different at other sites within the county, such as pharmacies or other providers.
Everywhere in Madera county those who are 16+ in the following group are eligible: Long-Term Care staff and residents, Medical first responders, Emergency Services, Food & Ag, Educational Institutions, or Licensed Childcare, Individuals who reside or work in a high risk congregate residential setting, such as an incarceration/detention facility, homeless shelter, or behavioral health facility, Public transit/airport and commercial airlines. Public transit workers, including airport and commercial airline workers (but not private airplanes).

Healthcare providers may use their clinical judgement to vaccinate individuals age 16-64 who are deemed to be at the very highest risk for morbidity and mortality from COVID-19 as a direct result of one or more of the following severe health conditions, and individuals in specified settings are eligible to be vaccinated due to increased risk, as specified in this provider bulletin here: [Provider Bulletin (ca.gov)](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx)

Individuals with these conditions are strongly encouraged to seek vaccination with a primary health care provider or system, or in an alternate clinical setting. Check first with your usual health care provider.

**County restrictions**: Must be a Madera county resident or work in Madera county

**Appointment Information**: To make an appointment for the FIRST VACCINE, fill out the form at this link: <https://tinyurl.com/j5u6bj89> or to make an appointment for the SECOND VACCINE, fill out the form at this link: <https://tinyurl.com/nca9kufw>

**Phone numbers**: Individuals who have questions can call the county at 3-1-1. To receive text updates, text MADERAVAX to 888777

**Additional Info: **There is also an Overflow list, when appointments are filled. To add your name to the Waitlist, click this link: [Online Survey Software | Qualtrics Survey Solutions](https://qaz1.az1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_5baCrN1FQJQEoQK)

(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**: Age 18+ at County sponsored Clinics. 

**County restrictions**: Must be residents of, or work in Yuba-Sutter counties. 

**Appointment Information**: 
ls can only be made to (530) 634-7496 Wednesdays after 9:00 am

Additional Info: New Clinic information is released on Wednesdays at 9am. Click on this link to see the clinics, https://tinyurl.com/mmmmj4fx

**Phone numbers**: To make appointments by phone, call
Yuba Sutter transit is offering free rides for Covid-19 vaccination appointments,
For Yuba-Sutter Transit service, route, and schedule information, visit http://www.yubasuttertransit.com or call (530) 742-2877.

Información en español: <https://tinyurl.com/bfz54743>

(Updated: Apr 5) **Eligibility:** 50+, Education and Childcare, Emergency Services, 16+ with specific high-risk medical conditions or disabilities according to state guidelines: <https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/vaccine-high-risk-factsheet.aspx> 

**County Restrictions:** Must be a resident of Humboldt County.

**Appointment Information:** The best way for county residents to be notified of an available appointment at a Public Health clinic is to fill out the online Interest Form in [English](http://humboldtgov.org/InterestForm) or [Spanish](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdkkP56aNbxfW98_FebzcRj9qZV2e64RXPz8W0EDr7xLUZOcw/viewform). The county or a local healthcare provider will notify residents when they are eligible and the vaccine is available. For more information about eligibility and appointment scheduling, please click here: <https://humboldtgov.org/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=3779> 

**Phone Numbers:** Individuals without access to email or the internet can contact the COVID Community Information Line at 707-441-5000 between 8 AM - 5 PM Monday through Friday.

**Additional Info:** Starting Apr 15, all county residents 16+ will become eligible. Contact the COVID Community Information Line at 707-441-5000 or covidinfo@co.humboldt.ca.us. Para información en español: [Información sobre la Vacuna de COVID-19](https://humboldtgov.org/2887/La-Vacuna).

(Updated: Apr 5) **Eligibility:** 50+, Education and Child Care, Emergency Services, Food/Agriculture, and 16+ who have certain disabilities or health conditions according to state guidelines found here: <https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx> 

**County Restrictions:** Must live or work in Monterey County.

**Appointment Information:** Bring an official form of identification to your appointment that shows your name and date of birth, as well as confirmation of your appointment if you have it. For locations and appointment information please click this link on Google Chrome: <https://www.co.monterey.ca.us/government/departments-a-h/health/diseases/2019-novel-coronavirus-covid-19/vaccination-registration>. Eligibility information can also be found in Spanish here: <https://www.co.monterey.ca.us/Home/ShowPublishedImage/33190/637503002081948806> 

**Phone Numbers:** Call the county's COVID-19 Hotline at 831-769-8700 between 8 AM and 5 PM Monday through Friday, or email [covid-19@co.monterey.ca.us](http://covid-19@co.monterey.ca.us).

**Additional Info:** Starting Apr 15, all county residents 16+ will be eligible.

(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**: Age 50+, and (as supplies allow) workers in education, childcare, food & agriculture, fire, law enforcement, and emergency services, Transit and transportation workers, Residents and staff of homeless shelters, behavioral health facilities, incarceration/ detention centers and other at risk congregate setting.

Individuals age 16-64 with a medical condition or disability that puts them at high risk for severe sickness and death as defined by the California Department of Public Health (CDPH). Click this link: <https://tinyurl.com/z8exakt8> to see the CDPH prioritization list. 

**County restrictions**: Must be a resident of Santa Cruz. 

**Appointment Information**: If you wish to sign up  for vaccines, please click this link:  **[http://MyTurn.ca.gov](http://myturn.ca.gov/)**.

**Phone numbers**: If you are over 65, call the Bridges to Access Vaccination Helpline to get assistance in obtaining the COVID-19
vaccine at (831) 219-8607. Leave a message with your name, phone number, age and zip code and you will  get a call back within 48 hours.

**Additional Info**: Residents interested in vaccines should first contact their medical provider. Vaccines are also available through sites listed on the chart below. Residents should also sign up for MyTurn to be notified once they are eligible, by visiting **[MyTurn.ca.gov](https://myturn.ca.gov/)**. The Public Health Division will distribute vaccine through the counties
**[local vaccine plan](https://www.santacruzhealth.org/Portals/7/pdfs/coronavirus/2020.12.7_FINAL%20C19%20Vax%20Template%20for%20Santa%20Cruz%20County.pdf)**.

For information about registering for an appointment with various health care providers, click this link: <https://tinyurl.com/ync6h3r7>

(Updated: Apr 5) **Eligibility**: 50+, Education and Child Care, Emergency Services, Food/Agriculture, Congregate Living Facilities (including staff and residents), all persons experiencing homelessness, Public Transportation (including airport and commercial airline workers - excluding private planes), and 16+ who have certain disabilities or health conditions according to guidelines found here: <https://covid-19.acgov.org/vaccines.page?#complex> 

**County Restrictions:** Must live or work in Alameda County.

**Appointment Information**: For locations and appointment information please click this link: <https://covid-19.acgov.org/vaccines.page?#eligibility-hcp>. 

**Phone Numbers:** Contact the county public health department at 510-268-2101.

**Additional Info:** Sign up to be notified when a vaccine is available for you by filling out this form in [English](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=LP_9Mm74o0ukfWpEp_RaZJQMTGauARpLj6XkpVpiJ3FUMUwwTk8yTFNHWDA3UUFGSzE4NlQ4RlNMWi4u), [Spanish](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=LP_9Mm74o0ukfWpEp_RaZJQMTGauARpLj6XkpVpiJ3FUMUVYUTEwU1lPU0VIM1paVzI4RTZaQzQ3Sy4u), or [Chinese](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=LP_9Mm74o0ukfWpEp_RaZJQMTGauARpLj6XkpVpiJ3FUNTRFTlA1Qk9NUjU2VVQwMlJWUjRYOVlDMi4u).

(Updated: Apr 5) **Eligibility**: 50+, Food and Agriculture (including Veterinary Services), Education and Childcare, Emergency Services, Congregate Living Spaces, Transportation and Logistics (public transit/airport and commercial airlines), and 16+ who have certain disabilities or health conditions according to the guidelines found here: <https://sjready.org/events/covid19/vaccines.html> 

**Appointment Information**: If you are eligible for a vaccine, please check with your Primary Care Physician, Doctor, or Healthcare Provider for vaccination opportunities first. Next, check with the Providers under the "Approved Vaccine Providers in San Joaquin County" and "Upcoming Vaccine Events" sections by clicking this link: [sjready.org/events/covid19/vaccines.html](https://sjready.org/events/covid19/vaccines.html). 

**Phone Numbers**: Contact 211 with any questions.

**Additional Info:** San Joaquin RTD is now providing free rides on all fixed-route buses traveling to county SJReady vaccination sites. To ride free, check your eligibility and book your appointment on MyTurn ([myturn.ca.gov](https://myturn.ca.gov)) or on SJReady ([sjready.org/events/covid19/vaccines.html](https://sjready.org/events/covid19/vaccines.html)), then show your appointment confirmation via a print-out or on your phone to the operator when boarding. More information can be found here: <https://sanjoaquinrtd.com/covid-19/#freerides> 

Starting Apr 15, all individuals 16+ will become eligible.

(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**: 16+ (For Pfizer vaccine. 18+ for Moderna and Johnson & Johnson vaccines)

**County restrictions**: Must live or work in Tehama County. Proof of residence or employment will be required at the time of vaccination. Acceptable forms are a photo ID, employer ID badge, employer payment stub or official letter from the employer.

**Appointment Information**: Tehama County uses My Turn, the California Department of Public Health COVID-19 Vaccine scheduling system: <https://myturn.ca.gov>

**Phone numbers**: For assistance in registering with My Turn, dial: (833) 422-4255. To talk to the Tehama County Health Services Agency about topics other than vaccine appointment scheduling, dial: (530) 527-6824.

**Additional information**: You can contact the Tehama County Health Services Agency at: [publichealth@tchsa.net](mailto:publichealth@tchsa.net)

(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**: Age 18+

**Mariposa County Public Health **will be pulling names from our COVID-19 Vaccine Contact List and have enough doses to reach more people than we currently have on the list. If you or people you know are eligible, please visit [www.mariposacounty.org/vaccine](http://www.mariposacounty.org/vaccine?fbclid=IwAR1O3LDtoN7KBswPJoYI-2oFo8nc4twk6ZRMnecHa_h7Vz5t-thHLhcA-dA).

The qualifying conditions are highlighted in the [California Department of Public Health Provider Bulletin](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx). If you qualify based on this list, please have your provider or specialist complete and return the [High-Risk Referral Form](http://www.mariposacounty.org/DocumentCenter/View/88110) via:
--email (_[vaccine@mariposacounty.org](mailto:vaccine@mariposacounty.org))_ or 
--delivery to the county office at 5362 Lemee Lane, Mariposa, CA 95338 (mailing address P.O. Box 99, Mariposa, CA 95338)
Please mark _"Attention: Mariposa County COVID-19 Vaccine Team"_

**County restrictions**: Must be a resident of Mariposa county

**Appointment Information**: Fill out a form to be placed on the contact list, by clicking on this link: <https://tinyurl.com/33t58bv7> If you have already submitted your contact information and have not been called yet, please dial (209) 966-1133 for a recorded update on where our County currently is in the vaccine administering schedule.

**Phone numbers**: If you do not have access to the internet, please call (209) 259-1332 for assistance

(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**:50+, Agriculture and food services, education and childcare, emergency services. Healthcare providers and pharmacies are also vaccinating Yolo County residents but may have different eligibility requirements. 
Individuals aged 16-64 who are deemed to be at the very highest risk to get very sick from COVID-19 will be eligible. Please see [CDHP Provider bulletin](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx).Verification of your diagnosis or disability is not required but you will be asked to self-attest in writing or verbally that you meet [this criteria from the State.](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx)  Also,  Public transit and Airport Workers for Commercial Airlines
**County restrictions**:Live or work in Yolo.

**Appointment Information**:Check for available clinics at https://www.yolocounty.org/coronavirus-vaccine 

**Phone numbers**:(833) 965-6268.

**Additional Info**:If you need a ride to a clinic.[Yolobus is offering free rides](https://www.yolobus.com/news/index.php/684) to Yolo County residents on their vaccine appointment days.
If you are homebound and need an in-home vaccine, call 211 or their toll free number: (855) 866-1783.
Yolo County's Facebook page has COVID briefings twice a week Mondays and Thursdays at 10am at <https://www.facebook.com/YoloCounty/> with the latest county information.

A limited number of vaccine appointments are available at a County-run clinic on April 7 in Woodland. You must make an appointment, be in an eligible group, and attend the 2nd dose appointment 3 weeks from now. Click on the Eventbrite link at: [https://yolocounty.org/coronavirus-vaccine…](https://t.co/v2Eod79m54?amp=1).

Anyone 18+ in zip code 95605 (West Sacramento) in Yolo County is eligible for vaccine at a clinic this Saturday (Apr10), walk ins welcome -> <https://www.facebook.com/243209425733901/posts/3750165338371608>

(Updated: Apr 5) **Eligibility:** 30+, 16-64 who is at [highest risk of serious COVID-19 illness or death due to severe health conditions](https://www.recoverslo.org/en/when-and-where-can-you-get-vaccinated.aspx#Residents-at-High-Risk-Because-of-Medical-Conditions-or-Disabilities), Education & Childcare, Emergency services, Food & Agriculture workers, Public Transit, Janitorial Services, Court System & Jurors, Residents at high risk because of certain severe medical conditions or severe high-risk disabilities, Residents who live or work in a homeless shelter or a behavioral health facility.

**County restrictions:** Must be a SLO county resident or work in SLO county

**Appointment Information:**
Visit this page to make an appointment:
<https://www.recoverslo.org/en/when-and-where-can-you-get-vaccinated.aspx> 

**Phone numbers:** Public Health Information Line at (805) 788-2903

**Additional Info:** Specific signup details for Essential workers (including Emergency services & Food and Agriculture) can be found on the County site.
<https://www.recoverslo.org/en/when-and-where-can-you-get-vaccinated.aspx>

Note: Residents with high-risk medical conditions or disabilities will be required to truthfully self-attest to their eligibility by having **[a high-risk medical condition as defined by the California Department of Public Health](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx)**.

(Updated: Apr 1) **Eligibility**: Vaccinating people 16+ who live or work in Butte County. 

Please note: residents who book a vaccination appointment through a community or hospital vaccination clinic that utilizes the MyTurn, the State’s scheduling system, will need to check the ’65-74’ age range option to get the scheduling process started. This is due to a current limitation within the State’s online scheduling system. You will then be prompted to enter your date of birth at which time you will enter your actual date of birth.

**Appointment Information**: Appointment information can be found here: https://www.buttecounty.net/ph/COVID19/vaccine

**Phone numbers**: For residents without internet, you may call the Vaccine Scheduling Hotline at 530-552-3020 for assistance – please reserve this line for those without internet. Calling the hotline will not book your appointment faster.

**Additional Info:** Transportation is available to vaccination sites through the B-Line’s Paratransit service for persons 70 and older. An application must be completed in advance of the first ride. Applications can be requested over the phone at 530-809-4614, or downloaded at [tinyurl.com/ButteParatransit](http://tinyurl.com/ButteParatransit). A one-way ride on the Paratransit is $3.50.

(Updated: Apr 1) **Eligibility**: People 50+, as well as teachers and child care providers, first responders, food and agricultural workers, individuals experiencing homelessness, and inmates in county jails. 

**Appointment Information**: Information about vaccine appointments can be found here: https://www.smchealth.org/covid-19-vaccination

**Additional Info: **SamTrans will provide free bus rides on existing service to COVID-19 vaccination sites for people living or working within San Mateo County. [Read more here](https://www.samtrans.com/about/MediaRelations/news/SamTrans_to_Provide_Free_Rides_to_Vaccination_Sites_in_San_Mateo_County.html).

(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**: Age 18+ at County sponsored Clinics. 

**County restrictions**: Must be residents of, or work in Yuba-Sutter counties. 

**Appointment Information**: To make an appointment for the FIRST or SECOND VACCINE, click on this link:  <https://tinyurl.com/5ban9u3s> New
Clinic information is released on Wednesdays at 9am.

**Phone numbers**: To make appointments by phone calls can only be made to (530) 822-5985 between the hours of 9 am-4 pm M-F

**Additional Info**: Yuba-Sutter transit is offering free rides for Covid-19 vaccination appointments,
For Yuba-Sutter Transit service, route, and schedule information, visit http://www.yubasuttertransit.com or call (530) 742-2877.

If there are no more appointments available, consider signing up to be wait-listed in the event the clinic has "no shows" or cancellations. The waitlist DOES NOT GUARANTEE you a spot for an appointment for the clinic. In the event you do not get called, please register for our next county clinic.

Información en español: <https://tinyurl.com/ysyss4mw>

(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**: Individuals 50+ years of age (regardless of occupation or health status), and education and childcare workers; emergency services (non-medical first responders: law enforcement and fire); food and agriculture (grocery stores, restaurant workers, etc.)

Also eligible are people 16 years and older who have an underlying health condition or disability which increases their risk of severe COVID-19, and/or:

Also: those at risk of exposure at work in the following sectors: 
Transportation and logistics; industrial, commercial, residential and sheltering facilities and services; congregate settings with outbreak risk (homeless/unhoused, incarcerated individuals, jails and prisons.

Those at risk of exposure at work in the following sectors:
Water and wastewater; defense; energy; chemical and hazardous materials; communications and IT; financial services; government operations / community-based essential functions. 

**County restrictions**: Must live or work in Mono County.

**Appointment Information**: Vaccination pre-registration required via this form: <https://webapps.mono.ca.gov/covid19/vaccinate-mono-form/> . You will be contacted by the Public Health Department to register for your vaccination appointment.

 If you are unable to complete the vaccine questionnaire online or by phone, or you have questions, please send an email to **[COVID19help@mono.ca.gov](mailto:COVID19help@mono.ca.gov)**. You will receive a reply within 1-2 days. 

**Phone numbers**: Individuals without access to the internet can call (760) 924-1830 for assistance in the pre-registration process.

**Additional information**: Second homeowners are not eligible to receive the vaccine in Mono County. Acceptable proofs of permanent residency can be found here: <https://coronavirus.monocounty.ca.gov/pages/vaccinations/#eligibility>

(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**: People 50 years and older; education and childcare workers; emergency services workers; food and agriculture workers; people with [certain health conditions or disabilities](https://sf.gov/information/other-conditions-eligible-covid-19-vaccine-sf); people living or working in [congregate living settings](https://sf.gov/information/other-conditions-eligible-covid-19-vaccine-sf) (homeless shelters, correctional facilities, or other treatment facilities); people experiencing homelessness; healthcare workers [See vaccination options for healthcare workers)](https://sf.gov/information/healthcare-worker-vaccination-san-francisco)

**County restrictions**: Vaccinations are free for people who live or work in San Francisco

**Appointment Information**: The page includes appointments for county and private-provider sites: https://sf.gov/get-vaccinated-against-covid-19

**Phone number**: For those who don't have internet access or have difficulty using websites, San Francisco recommends calling the state's MyTurn appointment system: (833) 422-4255.

**Additional information**: [Sign up to get notified](https://sf.gov/get-notified-when-its-your-turn-vaccine/form) when it's your turn for the vaccine.
You can ride [Muni or Paratransit for free](https://www.sfmta.com/blog/free-muni-and-paratransit-covid-19-vaccine-appointments), to and from your appointment.

(Updated: Apr 5)  **Eligibility:** 16+

**County restrictions:** Must be a Contra Costa county resident or work in Contra Costa county

**Appointment Information:**
Each eligible group has specific signup links on the website. See <https://www.coronavirus.cchealth.org/get-vaccinated>

**Phone numbers:** Individuals without access to the internet can call the Public Health Services Department at 1-833-829-2626.

(Updated Apr 6) **Eligibility**: All Sierra County Residents 18 years or older regardless of medical conditions, as well as previous tiers of 65+, or in Education, Emergency services, Childcare, and Food and Agriculture workers

**County restrictions**: Must be a Sierra county resident

See options for scheduling vaccinations here: <https://sierracounty.ca.gov/616/About-Vaccine-for-COVID-19>

(Updated Apr 6) **Eligibility**: 50+, or Education & Childcare Workers, Food & Agriculture Workers and Emergency services, and Individuals 16-64 with underlying health conditions

**Appointment Information**: For locations and appointment information please click this link: <https://www.co.siskiyou.ca.us/publichealth/page/covid-19-vaccine-information>. 

**Phone numbers**: For questions or concerns please call (530) 841-2134 or email [phinfo@co.siskiyou.ca.us](mailto:phinfo@co.siskiyou.ca.us)

**Additional Information**: For information about underlying health conditions that make you eligible to receive the vaccine please click here: <https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx> 

Eligibility is expanding soon to cover:
- Individuals 50 or older - **effective April 1, 2021** 
- Every Californian 16 or older - **effective April 15, 2021**

(Updated Apr 6) **Eligibility**: 50+, or in Education, Emergency services, Childcare, and Food and Agriculture workers, Utility workers, disaster service workers, social workers, and 16-64 age group that are at highest risk due to health conditions

**Appointment Information**: For locations and appointment information please click this link: <https://www.icphd.org/health-information-and-resources/healthy-facts/covid-19/covid-19-vaccine/vaccine-providers/> 

**Phone numbers**: Phone assistance at 442-265-1444, will be available Monday through Friday from 8:00 am to 12:00 pm and 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm. The office will be closed for lunch from 12:00 pm to 1:00 pm.

Persons 65 and older who may need additional assistance, please contact the Area Agency on Aging at 442-265-7033 or 442-265-7040

**Additional Information: **For a list of conditions that make 16-64 year old people eligible to the vaccine, please click this link: <https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx>

(Updated Apr 6) **Eligibility**: 50+, or Non-medical first responders, Teachers and Childcare workers, and Food and Agriculture workers, and those with medical conditions that put them under higher risk.

See this press release for a list of health conditions that will make you eligible to get the vaccine: <https://www.inyocounty.us/sites/default/files/2021-03/Vaccine_Expands.pdf> 

**County restrictions**: Must be an Inyo county resident

**Additional Information: **Please sign up for **[the Inyo County Registration list](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfxml4iOjuCy2dwsppYDHK-bpCbZA2uU0lM699zlVtllE7o5Q/viewform)** to receive email updates to find out when vaccine will be available to you. Updates are sent weekly to everyone on the Inyo County Registration list. You can also see details about vaccine clinics opening up in the county and their eligibility criteria here: https://www.inyocounty.us/covid-19/local-updates

(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**: 50+, or employed in education, emergency services, childcare, or food and agriculture. Also people living or working in homeless shelters or congregate behavioral health settings; people experiencing homelessness.
Also eligible now are people 16-64 with high-risk medical conditions including but not limited to: cancer, chronic kidney disease, chronic pulmonary disease, down syndrome, immunocompromised state, pregnancy, sickle-cell disease, heart conditions (excludes hypertension), severe obesity, Type II diabetes; individuals with a developmental or severe high-risk disability that puts them at risk for severe illness or interferes with their ability to receive effective treatment for COVID-19.

**County restrictions**: Must live or work in Kings County. Proof of address and/or employment status in Kings County will be required at the time of your appointment.

**Appointment Information**: To check eligibility and book an appointment at Kings County Public Health use: <https://myturn.ca.gov> . If you need assistance in making an appointment, Call the California COVID-19 Hotline: (833) 422-4255 (M-F 8AM-8PM, Sa-Su 8AM-5PM)
Transportation is available by KART: Please call (559)852-2776 to request transportation to your vaccine appointment. Please provide a 24 hour notice prior to your appointment time.

(Updated: Apr 1) **Eligibility**: Nevada County is currently focusing on vaccination of people 50+, as well as those working in education & childcare, emergency services and food/agriculture, and people with health conditions that put you at the highest risk for extreme complications from COVID-19. [More details here](https://www.mynevadacounty.com/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=3686).

**Appointment Information**: Public Health is releasing appointments every Friday at noon on [MyTurn.ca.gov](http://myturn.ca.gov/) for appointments at the Whispering Pines Grass Valley vaccine clinic. 

**Additional Info**: A standby list is available for those working in Education and childcare, Emergency services. and Food and Agriculture. This list is for same-day appointments at our Grass Valley clinic to ensure that no dose is wasted. Information about the standby list is available here: <https://www.mynevadacounty.com/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=3632>
 
To protect confidentiality, verification documentation of the diagnosis or type of disability is not required but instead anyone meeting the eligibility requirements will be asked to sign a self-attestation that they meet the criteria for high-risk medical conditions or disabilities.

(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**: LA County Residents 50 and Older; and people working in Education and Childcare; Emergency Services; Food and Agriculture; Janitorial, Custodial, and Maintenance Services; Transportation and Logistics; people who live or work in congregate living spaces; and people with any health conditions and disabilities [listed here](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/acd/ncorona2019/vaccine/hcwsignup/?level_1=step-1-eligibility&level_2=elig-health-conditions).

On April 15th, vaccines will become available to any resident in Los Angeles County who is 16 and older.

**Appointment Information**: Information to sign up for an appointment can be found here: http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/acd/ncorona2019/vaccine/hcwsignup/ 

**Phone numbers**: Residents with disabilities or without computer access can call [833-540-0473](tel:1-833-540-0473) between 8:00 am and 8:30 pm 7 days a week for assistance

[for more details](https://coronavirus.marinhhs.org/vaccine/distribution).

**Appointment Information**: Complete the vaccination interest form: <https://marincountyhc.jotform.com/210187732830049>
 
**Phone number**: County residents who have limited or no internet can call (833) 641-1988 to get live help, Mon-Fri, 8 am to 5 pm. This number  also is available to county residents age 65 or older; those living with disabilities and age 18 or older; those in need of home care or personal assistance; those who need language interpretation (including ASL); or those who need help arranging transportation to a vaccination appointment.

Emergency services workers, food and agriculture workers, Solano school employees, childcare workers and adult day care workers (staff only).
Homeless/unhoused people.
Transportation and logistics workers, including non-emergency transport providers
Industrial sector workers (commercial and residential
Critical manufacturing workers 
Essential workers in chemical, communications/IT, defense, energy, finance, water and wasteland, government operations and community services. 
[Details on these essential workforce segments](https://covid19.ca.gov/essential-workforce/)

**County restrictions**: Must live or work in Solano County.

**Appointment Information**: Complete the[ vaccine interest form](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=rCB_XvHlg0-MO85EuEhkIeMEzssrcWhHjglhgOOdcIxUOFA2UFpQSDY2MDNTWVRZVEpBOUQwTk5QTS4u)

**Phone number**: Solano Public Health COVID-19 "warmline":  (707) 784-8988

**Additional Info**: Information on vaccinations by healthcare providers in Solano County is available at: <https://solanocounty.com/civicax/filebank/blobdload.aspx?BlobID=33980>

(Updated: April 6)**Eligibility**: 16+, 

**County restrictions**:County Residents and eligible sector residents employed in SBC.

**Appointment Information**:<https://publichealthsbc.org/covid-19-vaccine-appointment-registration/>. 

**Phone numbers**:The county suggests calling 2-1-1 and select option 4, Child care workers information 805-925-7071. 
[#COVID19](https://twitter.com/hashtag/COVID19?src=hashtag_click) vaccine clinics increasing to 7 days per week beginning Sunday, 3/28/21, in [#Lompoc](https://twitter.com/hashtag/Lompoc?src=hashtag_click). Appointment registration is now open for all [#SantaBarbaraCounty](https://twitter.com/hashtag/SantaBarbaraCounty?src=hashtag_click) residents in eligible groups. Make an appointment now at: <https://publichealthsbc.org/community-vaccination-clinics/> or call 2-1-1 and select 4 
**Additional Info**: Appointments offered by the Santa Barbara County Public Health Department sites for this sector will be posted on Mondays at 9:00 am.

A new vaccination clinic is opening at Allan Hancock College in Santa Maria from April 5th to April 11th. Appointment registration begins Thursday April 1st at 9 a.m. for all [#SantaBarbaraCounty](https://twitter.com/hashtag/SantaBarbaraCounty?src=hashtag_click) residents in eligible groups. (Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**: Age 16+

**County restrictions**: Must be a Riverside county resident or work in Riverside county

**Appointment Information**: For FIRST DOSE Vaccine please click on this link:  [COVID-19 Vaccine (rivcoph.org)](https://www.rivcoph.org/COVID-19-Vaccine-with-Registration) or                                                
for a SECOND DOSE appointment, Riverside County health officials will reach out to residents through the contact method provided at the first appointment.

**Phone numbers**: For seniors 65 and older who need assistance, please dial 2-1-1 or (951) 329-4703

**Additional Info**: Residents who received their first dose at a private provider, should contact that same provider to schedule their second dose. 

NOTICE: Residents may now schedule their 2nd dose appointment at any of the RUHS-Public Health Clinics or Curative Clinics.

(Updated: Apr 5) **Eligibility**: 18+

**County Restrictions:** Must live or work in Modoc County.

**Appointment Information**: Individuals ages 16-17 are encouraged to join the waitlist by calling the COVID WarmLine at 530-233-1350 or 530-640-3171 between 8 AM and 5 PM Monday - Thursday. For more information, please click this link: <https://publichealth.co.modoc.ca.us/covid-19_information/covid-19_vaccine/index.php> 

**Phone Numbers**: Call the county's COVID WarmLine at 530-233-1350 or 530-640-3171 between 8 AM and 5 PM Monday - Thursday with any questions.

**Additional Info**: The county anticipates providing 200 doses during the week of Apr 5-9.

(Updated: Apr 6) **Eligibility**: Age 18+ at Amador County Public Health vaccination clinics, but it may be 50+ at other locations in the county, such as pharmacies. Also eligible are Amador residents with chronic health conditions (age 18 & over), health care workers, first responders, educators, community outreach workers, agriculture workers, grocery store workers, restaurant and food service workers, caregivers and childcare providers. 

Vaccine appointments for Amador County Public Health vaccination clinics may be scheduled by accessing clinic registration links on the Amador County Vaccine Information webpage: [https://www.amadorgov.org/.../covid-19/vaccine-information](https://www.amadorgov.org/services/public-health/covid-19/vaccine-information?fbclid=IwAR0Mmo8oOJxE_LvDRIe8j4yL2MrW3TwcAVpzJywQOnCL5os6taZ5Z7RMGUM)

**County restrictions**: Must live or work in Amador County. 

**Appointment Information**: To see upcoming vaccine clinics run by the county as well as other locations, please click this link: <https://tinyurl.com/drwue7k3> 
County-run vaccine clinics are announced via e-notification as well. To sign up for Amador County e-notification visit the Amador County website: https://www.amadorgov.org/about/e-notifications and choose “Health & Safety” notifications

**Phone numbers**: If you don’t have access to the internet, you can call Amador Dept of Public Health (209) 223-6407

**Additional Info**:

(Updated: Apr 5)  **Eligibility:** 18+

**County restrictions: **Must be an Alpine county resident (whether full-time resident OR part-time resident & property owner) or essential worker in Alpine county.

**Appointment Information:**
As of Feb 24th, County is requesting anyone 18+ (that is eligible as per the "county restrictions" section above) to call the Warm Line below and register their interest. A list will be complied, and names will be prioritized based on age, underlying medical conditions,
occupation, and residency.

- Woodfords and Bear Valley – call the Warm Line at 530-694-1011
- Washoe Tribal Health Center – call 775-265-8622

**Phone numbers:** Individuals without access to the internet can call the Warm Line at 530-694-1011.

**Additional Info:** <https://alpinecountyca.gov/DocumentCenter/View/4272/ACPHB-vaccine-eligibility-update-22421?bidId=>

(Updated Apr 6) **Eligibility**: 50+, Cafeteria workers, fast food and restaurant employees, delivery systems, recycling operations, crosswalk guards, bus drivers, daycare providers, food, feed, beverage distribution, education, childcare, public transit, and  Emergency Services including couriers, social workers, utility workers (electricity, gas, water, waste, roads/highways) that provide emergency support, individuals with high-risk medical conditions, and family members of all vaccine eligible persons.

**Effective March 25, 2021:** If a person that is eligible under the current criteria **comes in with a family member, the family member is allowed to receive the vaccine “no questions asked”**

**County restrictions**: Must be a Fresno county resident or work in Fresno county

**Appointment Information**: Appointments can be booked through MyTurn at <https://myturn.ca.gov> 

**Phone numbers**: Fresno County residents who do not have internet access can call MyTurn at 1-833-422-4255 to sign up for a notification for when it’s their turn to get vaccinated against COVID-19. MyTurn operators speak English and Spanish, with an ability to add a third-party operator in 254 languages. 

**Additional Information**: Those with high-risk medical conditions and unable to visit a medical provider can complete and bring the following form indicating they self-attest to having a medical condition under the [CDPH High-Risk Medical Conditions eligibility criteria](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx):
- High-Risk Medical Condition Self Attestation Form ([English](https://www.co.fresno.ca.us/home/showpublisheddocument?id=53028)) ([Spanish](https://www.co.fresno.ca.us/home/showpublisheddocument?id=53030))
**Upcoming changes to the COVID-19 vaccine eligibility:**
- **Effective April 1, 2021, all individuals 50+ years and older** will be eligible to receive the vaccine.
- **Effective April 15, 2021, all individuals 16+ years and older** will be eligible to receive the vaccine.
